div1.p: United States Consulate St. Paul de Loanda Augt 11. 1882.
To the Hon: J.C. Bancroft Davis Asst. Secty. of State Washington D.C.

Sir I have the honor to state that I have forwarded by same mail a monthly report of Diseases, Cases, and Deaths to the National Board of Health for the month of July; only of Europeans and mullatoes admitted to the hospital, but the diseases. cases, and deaths, occuring in the others different nature villages around the city of Loanda, such as the Cabindas, Caboundos, and crewsm are almost impossible to be obtained by the Portuguese govt. consequently more so by one.

The Bilhous or green fever and Dysentry are raging at present among Europeans and Mullatoes, the report I have sent was obtain from one
25
of the best doctores of this place: Another peculiar disease of a dysentic character amd which is at present causing great haror among the black children is called by the natives "macculot or macaullo", and is very quickly fatal if not attended ot at once, when it can be very easil cured It commences with diarrhea; the character of this disease is the production in the anal orfice both internally and externally of liittle vilcers containing small worms or maggots.--The Native mode of treatmebt although very cruel is quickly efficacious and cause it in plugging the orfice with a wad of crushed "filia and "Herva Santa Maria", dipped in strong solutiobs of Rum, lime twice powdered gun poweder and Cayene pepper.

This disease I was told is due to overcrowding quarters, want of cleanliness and improper goods; But change of places
20.
will also produce it, as it can be seen by the boys and girls captured or stolen in the interior and sold daily for a pretended 3 to 5 years servituded which last forever.
I have the honor to be Sir Your most obedient Servarnt L de R. du Verge U.S. Consul
